title: The 24-Hour Dough Rise
description: A slow-rise base that stays chewy and crisp.
inspiration: Ted started cold-fermenting dough to chase the airy crust from his favorite neighborhood slice shop.
ingredients: 00 flour, ice water, active dry yeast, sea salt, olive oil
steps:
Mix and knead the dough until smooth.
Cold ferment for 24 hours.
Bring to room temp before stretching.

title: Bright Tomato Sauce
description: A five-minute blitz for extra punch.
inspiration: The goal was to keep the sauce fresh and raw so it pops against the hot cheese.
ingredients: San Marzano tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, basil, sea salt
steps:
Blitz tomatoes and garlic until chunky.
Stir in basil, oil, and salt.
Taste and adjust before using.

title: Cheese Stack Rules
inspiration: Ted layers cheese to create a stretchy top and a gooey middle without soggy crust.
ingredients: Low-moisture mozzarella, fresh mozzarella, provolone, parmesan
steps:
Start with low-moisture mozz for melt.
Add fresh mozz in torn chunks.
Finish with provolone and parmesan.
